oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Role of infected, non-diseased badgers in the pathogenesis of tuberculosis in the badger
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Gallagher, J.
Monies, R.
Gavier-Widen, M.
Rule, B.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: badgers
Mycobacterium bovis
lymph nodes
tuberculosis
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The lungs and kidneys of 15 badgers which had no visible lesions of tuberculosis but from which Mycobacterium bovis was isolated from pooled collections of lymph nodes were serially sectioned. Full article published in Veterinary Record (1998) 142, 710-714.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: American Association of Bovine Practitioners Conference Proceedings; 1998; 88
